body.paragraph: Converts the passed string to a number. Extremely useful when trying to input numbers from the user using the input function

body.example:
a = "2"
b = "5"
text_add = a + b
number_add = int(a) + int(b)

body.paragraph: In the above example you a and b are string variables. The plus operator will concatenate string values, but will numerically add number values. So because int("2") equals to the numeric value two, and similarly for b, we are able to calculate the numeric addition of the two using int()
